website_summaries.verdict: One of the most affordable gaming keyboards on the market that still has many of the same features as more expensive models.
pros: Features a completely customizable, multi-colored backlight and programmable keys that can be used for macros
The quiet keys are comfortable to use and are spill-resistant
cons: The software needed to customize the keys and backlight can be confusing

customer_reviews.title: requires Synapse 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Synapse 2.0 (legacy) software, that controls the folowing peripherals Razer Abyssus Razer DeathAdder Chroma Razer Diamondback Razer Mamba Razer Mamba Tournament Edition Razer Naga Razer Naga Epic Chroma Razer Naga Hex Razer Orochi Razer Ouroboros Razer Taipan Razer Anansi Razer BlackWidow Chroma Razer BlackWidow Tournament Edition Razer BlackWidow Tournament Edition Chroma Razer BlackWidow Ultimate 2016 Razer BlackWidow Ultimate Stealth 2016 Razer DeathStalker Chroma Razer DeathStalker Ultimate Razer Orbweaver Chroma Razer Tartarus Chroma Razer Kraken 7.1 Chroma Razer Kraken 7.1 V2 Razer Kraken USB Razer Seirēn Pro Razer Blade Pro Razer Blade Razer Blade Stealth Will not control this device, so you will have to install Synapse 3.0, and run both at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I love that keyboard but I found myself missing the feel ...
customer_reviews.text: I am old school and grew up playing games on a membrane keyboard. I decided to make the switch to mechanical keyboards a year ago using the Corsair K70 LUX with red swtiches. I love that keyboard but I found myself missing the feel of membrane keys. I decided to give this keyboard a shot and immediately fell in love with it. It has a soft feel and the key presses are very quiet compared to mechanical switches. This has a 1000hz polling rate too making it very responsive. I have been using this for a little while now and it has become my daily driver. Excellent membrane key based keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Razer!
customer_reviews.text: Rock sold keyboard. Love the feel of the keys and sound of them. Lighting is awesome too. Not a RGB fan at all, but its nice to be able to have the KB lights the same as my mouse. :UPDATE: After less then a month of use, i had to return my KB for another one. Nothing major, but 2 keys started to get a real high pitched squeaking noise to the backspace and left shift. I had no issue whats so ever getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: J Walters

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Best Keyboard i ever had! This is the perfect keyboard! I was using a Cynosa non Chroma before and upgrading to the Chroma is the best decision i ever had! Will continue to buy Razer products!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Maningas

customer_reviews.title: Shift
customer_reviews.text: I'm rewriting my review because i bought this keyboard brand new and the shift button on this keyboard was very iffy to begin but i shrugged it off because it was at least working. But now it just plainly does not work. I have to get a new keyboard due to this
customer_reviews.author: Lupescorvum

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard but they log every keystroke
customer_reviews.text: I give this keyboard 1 star because of the extremely intrusive software/spyware that you have to use to control the lighting. The software to control the keyboard is web based and you have to log in use it otherwise you have no control of the lighting. While you're logged in they capture EVERY KEY STROKE you make, scan your pc for hardware and track everything you do on the web. Read the agreement before you use the software.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer J P

customer_reviews.title: Cool keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Razer keyboard, and is my favorite so far. I had the V2 with the quiet keys and I did not like it, gave it away. This one is much quieter, and the entire key lights up, not just the bottom one. I don't miss the extra keys on the V2 because I never really knew what to do with them. These keys seem as responsive to me as the V2 and when I type fast, I do not scare the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Get a different brand. Razer uses such a bloated configuration. (Get a Corsair one instead)
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to configure custom lighting setups. You'll be stuck with a premade flashing light setup for a while. Has to run a background program constantly. Tries to install like 6 other bloatware programs from Razer with it. You have to create an account with Razer or you can't change any settings on the keyboard. Update: after 1 month the keys squeak and creak. I have never even seen this happen in a keyboard. Apparently its common with Razer keyboards. Tech support was terrible about this, didn't help, said no to a replacement. Really feel like a fool for not buying Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard don't work unless you make a Razor account
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make a razor account but I cannot continue because it says the account is locked after I verified my email address. There should be an option to use the keyboard stand alone and not force to use an online account that I cannot get working. Update - after a few days the razor keyboard software randomly does not load, it also does not keep me logged in. Buggy, I would avoid this keyboard, the software for it does NOT work.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Bright and colorful, easy to see
customer_reviews.text: I had another keyboard that did rainbow, but it had only 3 options for lighting and red was hard to see. This has so many and is bright! I ended up going online and finding a whole community sharing profiles, and was able to find one I enjoy. I like that so much you can customize, or leave stock. The software was easy to use, though as mentioned I had to go find a profile to use, they didn't have stock options, though that's more on the software than keyboard side. Tactile, it's not really loud to press, and the keys are a smooth matte. There are stands in the back for elevation at two heights as well.
customer_reviews.author: Afura

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent non mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I realize mechanical is all the rage these days, but as someone who didn't grow up with it, and dual uses stuff for gaming and work i appreciate a quality option that is not mechanical, that was a huge requirement for me to get something. I also appreciate that while it has some RGB to it, it's not the typical unicorn vomit everyone else is offering. If you're an older gamer who wants something that works, but doesn't want your desk looking like it's straight out of fast and furious, this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Arsh88

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 Because Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased one originally for my husband because his original keyboard got messed up (gamer -- CS Go, WoW, etc). He really liked this one. His is still in perfect condition and the colors are beautiful when lit up. Additionally, my keyboard just went out (lights) 4 days ago so I couldn't see where / what I was typing. We ended up going with this again and I don't regret my decision in any way. It's quiet, bright, and very nice to type with (hand rest type hold below the spacebar). If I ever go wrong with any keyboards, I know where I'm turning to from now on. Worth every single penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aly Hammonds

customer_reviews.title: Worst new product I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: First keyboard that came was defective. The driver was installed properly and the device is not responding. The replacement keyboard is the same thing, driver was installed, device not responding. I tried contacting razer support but no response. Worst new product I ever bought. 2 consecutive defective products, really? This will be the last Razer product I will ever buy...
customer_reviews.author: Benjie Buenafe

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great and Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this keyboard twice now. It looks and feels great, and with both keyboards, keys start getting bound to each other for no reason. Last time, every time I hit my "R" key, the keyboard would enter "ER". Now, when I hit the "1" key, it enters "12" every single time. I've popped off those caps a dozen times, tried compressed air to maybe move something around. Reinstalled drivers, updates, restarted, windows updates, changes usb ports, nothing works. Great for aesthetic purchases. Terrible for reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Backlit Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard looks amazing! The backlighting has bright, vibrant colors, and I was truly surprised how good it looked when first turned on. It is also pretty quiet at well. I had a generic HP office keyboard before this, and I think this is even more quiet than that was. Also has a very simple design, which contributes to its elegance. I debated between this and the Hyper-X Alloy, and I am sure glad I went with this product. The Razer software also works very well, with complete customization. If you want a very nice non-mechanical keyboard, this is easily on the shortlist, if not the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: cyak1551

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Software could use some work.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is great. Customizations are great. Not to clicky and definitely not that loud. Works and feels amazing. The issue I had is that the software for it doesn’t always load up probably so I’m constantly having to open it back up and select a new light mode and go back to the previous one selected for it to work properly. Other than that it would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian V.

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great, with a couple of minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: Works and looks great. A huge number of color customization options, down to individual keys having different effects and colors. However the Razer website is totally unhelpful in identifying which games have built-in custom lighting support and how/if you need to set that up. Sometimes the lights would turn off and not come back on, making the letters hard to see. I think that problem has gone away since I made and logged in with a Razer account instead of as a guest in the Synapse software. I didn't want to make an account, but ok.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks and already had problems
customer_reviews.text: Only owned it for two weeks when every time I clicked the "f" key it typed out "df". Checked into it some more and found that Razer keyboards sometimes have a tendency to create ghost macro's that you can't get rid of. Tried using different usb slots, even a different computer and still didn't work. Sent it back to Amazon since its still only 2 weeks old and bought a better reviewed brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Your Co-Workers Won't Hate You As Much
customer_reviews.text: Just quiet enough to be good for an office setting. I love the programmable colors and it's relatively easy to set up. I have an adapter for my Macbook Pro and the keyboard doesn't do well drawing power off of it so I have to use a hub, but otherwise this keyboard is everything I could have asked for. It makes up for how bad the new Mac keyboards are.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: A decent keyboard, but bigger keys squeak a little bit
customer_reviews.text: I like the Razer products, they are generally pretty high quality. I needed a keyboard for my office since the one they supplied was an awful Staples wireless variety, and this one seemed like it would provide a good typing surface without worrying about keyclick noise. Unfortunately I have found that the shift and space keys squeak, as if the metal extenders under the keys never got oiled. I'm going to see if I can apply some oil to them myself to fix the issue because it is pretty annoying, and a bad mark on an otherwise seemingly good product.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. King III

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect quality and price for a Chroma RGB keyboard. Thank you Razer for making a lower priced RGB keyboard! I love the chroma, but $100+ was WAY too much for a keyboard. I'm honestly still shocked at your headset prices as well. Maybe make a lower model at the $40-$50 range. Thank you for creating something that brings your product to more people though, with a lower price point for a quality product. I'm excited to see a keyboard like this, but with an ultra low profile, for faster and smooth typing as well! <3
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard But Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard but the keys are not perfect. The keyboard is made of good quality construction and good build. The lights are super bright. With the Razer software, the lights transitions are smooth and beautiful. You can do a lot of customization but for someone who may only want solid or static color keys, this may be too much and overwhelming with options. Just wish the volume/mute/play/etc buttons were located over the dedicated number pad rather than into the top F keys. Other than that, a nice keyboard for the entry price for a gaming keyboard. Nice little brother to the Blackwidow.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a decent back lit full size keyboard without the mechanical clicky clacky at a good price The only thing this doesn't have, is dedicated media buttons so I have to hit the function button together with one of the F keys to change volume or other macros. Not a big deal, but not perfect. Brightness is great and easy to modify. You do get a lot of light around the keys so be aware of that if it matters to you. I can see the keys clearly, the photo is just above medium bright.
customer_reviews.author: Zaniix

customer_reviews.title: Great with few minor negatives (see details)
customer_reviews.text: I think this keyboard is great, although the Space Bar is a little squeaky, which I can live with. The Synapse 3 software can be a little confusing to get configured. This is a "membrane" keyboard, which pretty much means it's quieter than a mechanical keyboard. I had a Cynosa I loved, but accidentally spilled soda on it. So, I bought an Ornata which is a "hybrid" mechanical/membrane keyboard, but recently a couple keys were sticking so I went with an RMA and decided to just go ahead and buy this Cynosa V2.
customer_reviews.author: GregoPeck

customer_reviews.title: Bad keyboard, worse customer service (from Razor)
customer_reviews.text: The Shift key makes squeezing noise every time it is pressed since day 1. It literally drives me nuts when playing COD:MW with it. Contacted Razor for a replacement (because the user manual asks you to contact them instead of the retailer), they won’t send me a replacement until they receive the original or charge my credit card first. Total BS. I’m gonna send this one back to Amazon and stick with Logitech G from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Wang

customer_reviews.title: Decent lighted keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased the Huntsman, but couldn't take the loud clicks. The Huntsman is better in all areas except loudness. The Cynosa doesn't have the same kind of individual LEDs for the keys so the colors are more muted and blurred. The overall build is slightly less quality. The keys have a slight marshmallow feel that I don't mind and are very quiet. Didn't have to change anything on the Razer app when switching between models. That said, it's a decent keyboard for the price and hope it lasts for good while.
customer_reviews.author: ferndave

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Please tell everyone Macs work with it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. My only complaint is the software support for Mac. They keyboard only gives you instructions to install for PC. But what you don’t know is you can use it on a Mac. All you have to do is use older software that you can download from Razer’s Website that works with the keyboard. They just don’t tell you it will work with the new keyboard. Final closing words, I suggest Razer advertise that it works with Mac and what software with work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Zackary Bailey

customer_reviews.title: These keyboards are defective
customer_reviews.text: The first time I got the keyboard it was working fine for about 3 days until I noticed that the "H" key began to not work at all. After unplugging the keyboard and plugging it back in to try and get it to work again, the "H" key would work but would immediately begin to rapidly type itself over and over and backspace itself as well. I don't know what caused this. I returned it and got a new one 2 days later opened the box plugged it in and the same problem arose. I dont know if all the keyboards are defective in this specific way but becasue of this reason alone i would not reccomend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TH3GRAYZ

customer_reviews.title: Average- maybe better if you dont get a defect.
customer_reviews.text: so the keyboard is super quiet, like traditional cheap keyboards which is a good thing (noise wise). a few things i dont like about it.. software required to download so you can work on the colors, i'd rather have 20 presets that i can shuffle from than have some elaborate software that is kinda crappy and was a nightmare to install since it 'couldnt detect any compatible devices'. Another thing, i could have gotten a defect, but my 'delete' key is squeaky. every time i press the button, it has some annoying squeak. that button is used ALL THE TIME, and is super annoying that it's making noises.
customer_reviews.author: the smart one

customer_reviews.title: Razer customer service is a joke
customer_reviews.text: In the event that you actually get a bad one - beware. I've contacted customer service with a random disconnecting issue that was present right out the box. Ended up trashing the device and going with a different brand all together because of the unprofessional responses I got. Customer service takes a long time to respond. The representatives don't ask you for all the needed information right away, which in the end takes longer for your case to be resolved. Each time you contact them or even respond to your particular case you get thrown to a new rep. My biggest gripe was that their go to solution was: "Try it on another computer, may be it'll work fine there".
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kass

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: The feel and look of it is great. The under lighting isnt really noticeable while im sitting at it, but its so colorful I hardly notice. I do notice it when I'm afk since I leave it on all the time. Love that it syncs with all my Chroma and Philips Hue Lights. Great feel to it, though Itook a star off because some of my keys tend to squeak as I press down. Which I've never dealt with before. I'll give it some time, but if it becomes annoying I'll have to replace it or switch to the Huntsman.
customer_reviews.author: ajaystxus

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Mechanical RGB Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. The RGB effects don't require software (although you can download their software to customize - haven't tried it) and the lights are really pretty. The keyboard is pretty quiet, since red switches don't click. If you type too hard, it makes a sound of the key hitting the bottom of the keyboard. But if you don't type super hard, then it's not very loud at all. Great intro to mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Val Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, complicated app.
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming and work. I am a video editor and this keyboard works great! The keys are pretty silent and the lighting is bright enough to notice but not to bright that it’s distracting. The one thing I’m still struggling with is the app to control lighting and add or modify macros. It’s somewhat intuitive but it takes time to learn all the stuff you can do with it. Could be a bit more intuitive or at least have a more in-depth tutorial to utilize all of its features. Overall great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Baez

customer_reviews.title: It's a keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's marginally better than a cheap membrane keyboard when it comes to the keys themselves. The RGB is impressive, but I eventually returned the item when I got sick of the RGB and realized that the actual typing experience left something more to be desired. If you like RGB keyboards, this is a great choice. If you want a keyboard that is good to type a lot on, look elsewhere. This keyboard is for gaming, and that's about it. For $40 I would recommend it for strictly gaming, but besides that, I find it hard to recommend for more than that or for more general applications.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Riefe

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I'm not a gamer. I love the gaming tech, I have a gaming laptop, I built a gaming desktop, and I have a Razer keyboard and mouse. But I don't play PC games. I am a software developer, data analyst, student, and author. So I type. A lot. This keyboard is very cool with the Razer Synapse software, in terms of the colors and effects. It is durable, and spill-resistant. But most importantly, it is very comfortable to type on. I love it, and the ability to change/customize macros and keys is very useful for me. Overall, I would give more than 5 stars if I could. Way to go, Razer. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: when i purchase this keyboard it was with two years warranty after one years it stop fuctioning , several keys were not working and was making gaming impossible, i spoke with a customer services and he told ,me that my device was under 2 years and was about to send me another one but i received another email from a diferent guy saying that my device was covered for only 1 years, they dont even know what they are doing, they do not honor their words DO NOT PURCHASE THIS KEYBOAR IT WILL BREAK AFTER 1 YEARS ALL RAZER PRODUCT ARE DESIGN TO DO SO!
customer_reviews.author: wellington

customer_reviews.title: So cool! Boyfriend loves it.
customer_reviews.text: It's bright (adjustable brightness), colorful, and comfortable. There's a program you have to install for free that is instructed within the enclosed booklet which allows you to customize the keyboard colors and whatnot. There's one option where you can make the keys look like there's flames beneath and we totally love that. The keys are soft (no sound, not mechanical) and I think this keyboard can sync with Razer mice, color-wise. This was a great price for a great keyboard - an amazing upgrade from the old, worn-down keyboard my boyfriend had before.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Faulty backspace key. Squeaks every time you press it
customer_reviews.text: Finally was happy to get my keyboard as I am now working from home, The keyboard build is great however once I started using it I noticed a defective. Every time you press the backspace key it squeaks rather loudly. All other keys are whisper quiet when you press them, but the backspace key decides to make that loud squeak. Not even sure how its doing that as it was new out of the box, but might be a bad keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Missing basic features.
customer_reviews.text: I should have investigated the keyboard a little more before buying. There's a reason it's so cheap. It's missing a lot of basic keys that even my $10 junker keyboard has. - no standalone media keys (pause/play/skip/etc) - no standalone volume keys - no standalone macro keys Most of those missing standalone keys have a function key instead (hold the fn key then press the associated F# key).
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboards responsive and very nice to the touch. The lighting brightness is customizable. Also the keyboard feels sturdy like it will last long time. My one complaint is that if my computer is off and I just bump the keyboard the lights will come on and they won't go off again unless I power cycle my computer. The lights should go off after a certain time off inactivity.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the keyboard, downloaded the software, and it won't launch..... and the lights don't light up either... The keys are not for me, they feel squishy and don't have a good feedback of when they were pressed. Edit* - Lauch application will NOT launch application until you log in. Curious as to why they thought that UI design choice would be good. However after install keyboard was not being detected, After a reboot it was detected, and now a software update is available??? I JUST downloaded your crapware why is it not the current version?
customer_reviews.author: wojciech ciula

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard clean and simple keyboard with custom RGB
customer_reviews.text: This is the first keyboard I bought that actually feels great and has good lighting. Used it to replace and old board that broke down. +Pretty great RGB +clean and simple look +software was ready to install as soon as I plugged it in to my PC. It's a little confusing to use the app that it comes with but it's easy to get used to and goes through a tutorial. It's been very reliable and honestly worth my upgrade. No issues or concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Licona

customer_reviews.title: Numpad 6 key was DOA and it took me a month to realize it.
customer_reviews.text: Really cool looking keyboard but after only a month of use I noticed today that the number 6 key on the numpad doesn't work. Yes the numpad is on. I can type 012345789/*-+. Every key on the keyboard but the numpad 6 key works. Pretty sure it was DOA and I'm just now noticing it. I don't use the numpad very often. I honestly expected better from Razer. On a positive note, the keys feel nice and the LED effects are bright and really cool looking!
customer_reviews.author: Aliby

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for console gaming use!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product and great quality. However this keyboard requires the installation of drivers for the lighting and programming features. Designed for desktop computers. My kid wanted a cool looking keyboard to use with his ps4. So its not a good idea to spend the money on this if you are planning on using it for your PlayStation or Xbox. All the cool stuff about this keyboard isn't controllable if you plan to do that. Also, its not the mechanical 'heavy click' sound style.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: ESC Key doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard overall. It lights up just fine (great to use at night), is quiet, and great to type with. My ESC Key unfortunately never will work with this keyboard. I cannot recommend it to game, as ESC is an important key to be able to use in many games. When hitting "ESC" all it does is flash the lights. I've never had this issue before with any other keyboard I've purchased from any other company.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: First Razer Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed in this keyboard. First thing I noticed taking it out of the box is that it's all cheap plastic, definitely nothing fancy. Plugged it in and instantly knew I was returning it. The keys are unevenly lit. The backlighting is splotchy with dark spots. It looks really bad and cheap. Had the return setup within minutes of receiving this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Just Honest

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical Technicality Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard feels smooth all over. The keys have a coating to keep your fingers from sliding off them. The ability to customize the lighting to suit your style is one of the fanciest things you could do on this product through Razer Central. It is definitely a great budget Esport quality gaming-keyboard for those on a budget, do to it having the new Razer Laser press detection technology in it. Thank you. #irvinSalgadoRoman #RazerStreamer
customer_reviews.author: irvin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and easy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. But been using it for a while and the backspace button kind of makes a squeaky sound. The lighting and Everything is super nice. No complains whatsoever. It's plug and play and it automatically installs razers chroma so that's that. Great keyboard to type too as I do a lot of typing. Absolutely great but, not worth the whole 5 Stars. Would recommend. A good 4.5 would be good.
customer_reviews.author: Aashutosh

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: he needed a new keyboard for gaming and picked this one. shortly after he got it he called me into the room to give me the "tour" as he called it. I gotta say I'm not a bog gamer but this thing is cool! even made me think of getting one myself. it even "Syncs" with some online games so its colors match the game/character! (he showed me how it worked with Overwatch)
customer_reviews.author: David M. Bieri

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking and responsive, but so, so squeaky
customer_reviews.text: Just as above. Very nice looking and easy to use keyboard, but it SQUEAKS like a rusty wagon wheel whenever I use the spacebar, comma, period or shift keys. Spacebar is especially noticeable because I use it so much.....when I'm typing at a fast clip it's a constant 'squeak squeak squeak' of high pitched total irritation. I've tried wiggling it, condensed air-ing it and waiting it out but it still sounds like a kid's tricycle wheel. I would consider buying a different keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: alqualonde

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard! Feels great and responds well!!!
customer_reviews.text: Razer makes great products! I have a mouse and a keyboard (this one) and this is amazing. It feels great to type on and responds well. In addition, I love the leds on it! I don't game, but the led's are awesome. I have it setup to play to the beat of the music I'm working on, while working on my desktop. It doesn't distract, but adds just a little ambiance feel. I would definitely get this again and recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Bullz

customer_reviews.title: best keyboard that I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard 2 years ago when i lived at home, and it served well for all types of uses. I used it for gaming, programming, and even school work, like writing papers. I loved it so much that I bought another one for my new place! The lights are easily controllable through the razor chroma app. Installation is simple, just plug it into as usb or usb-hub hub in your computer and it works right away! I would strongly recommend this product for anyone who wants a multiversitle and high quality keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Faiq Ashraf

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard reliably for about a year now. It's been a great keyboard, so much better than my old generic one. Feels like a more expensive keyboard without the absurd price. I've used more expensive keyboards and this one feels comparable. I subtracted a star because it forced me to create an account to be able to use its software. That seemed completely unnecessary to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The RGB lighting is sharp and fully customizable, with no light bleed. The keys are so soft they just feel like a kitten's fur, and the typing feels smooth and natural. Best of all, it won't even fade because it's solid black plastic with clear plastic for the writing on it. I've had it for several months now, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I love the style and the colors
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap very well made keyboard, with it's own software to change rgb change the flow of the colors and its simple. You like breathing effects? It has it. You like rainbows? It has it. Overall no complaints and works super well for gaming would definitely buy again and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cazares

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard, nice rgb, until some of thekeys malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I got the first Chroma Cynosa late July, it was a good keyboard and the chroma lighting effects are really cool. The problem started emerging when some of the keys on the num pad began to type other random characters. I called support, and they agreed to replace it. It took two weeks to get another one. I set the new one up and it worked just fine. For another month or so. Then the same issue came up but for different keys. It renders those keys completely unusable. The cheaper, Chinese-branded keyboard I replaced this one with lasted me two years without issue. I'd advise against buying this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: thuggin’ Abe

customer_reviews.title: Pretty.......
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a few RGB keyboards, Razor seems to know what they're doing. Wish I'd gotten the more expensive Black Widow with the microswitches, but hey this one still works. Also, rainbow colors and customizing every single button is way more fun than it has any business being.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M

customer_reviews.title: JUNK.  PURE JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these roughly the end of April for working from home. Since then both have failed. Some keys repeat, some don't register, but both are now completely useless. My how Razer has fallen, never buying another Razer product as long as I have a computer. Do your research and get another companies product.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: ! Just make sure to go to their website and get the proper software.
customer_reviews.text: Nephew adores it! Was easy to install. Just make sure that you go online to their website to download the software for your particular keyboard. Once you do, it syncs with your computer and you are able to select all of the color settings. It was a little difficult to find out where we needed to go in order to get the software though. The insert in the Box did not make itself as clear as it could because it was trying to be accessible into many languages.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Victoria Duren

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for Light Gaming and Everything Else!
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing this keyboard, my needs were something that allowed for more comfortability than my regular laptop keyboard, added aesthetic to my desk setup, and performed well. This Razer Cynosa Lite was EXACTLY what I was looking for and more. I was really happy with the price (first and foremost) and the added bonus of having the Razer brand. I love the feel and sound of the keyboard and the customizable backlighting as well. Even in full light exposure, the backlighting is still visible! So happy I went with the Cynosa Lite!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming keyboard ever made
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard so much it works on my laptop and gaming consoles too I got this as a reward from GAMEKIT but they are responsible for big gifts instead they give a Amazon gift card for the item I was so happy to get it and I did a unboxing video on YouTube my YouTube channel is MIKEUNIX94 GAMER and also I'm a Amazon prime member rock on GAMEKIT And Amazon prime too 😭😀😅😄🤩😎😋🤗😁☺️😆🤣😉😊⬆️⬆️🔥🔥😂
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL J DUKE

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, feels great
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable design and works fine for my gaming and work purposes. Having to use the "fn" key to adjust volume with the keyboard is a little irritating, but I'm also not a fan of keyboards with too many extra buttons. The backlighting looks really cool, but beware: all of your crumbs will be backlight as well. Don't ever eat over this thing. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: JasonC

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing
customer_reviews.text: The lighting on the keyboard is clear and radiant, not like some of the cheaper options out there. It's really just nice to sit and look at. I got into some of the custom lighting setups with Chroma Studio and it sure is pretty to layer the lighting effects on top of each other. The keyboard itself is also well made and the layout is simple, without any of the extra bloat you see on a lot of keyboards. It is perfect for my needs and the dazzling colors are beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Rossen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Survive a Spill
customer_reviews.text: This was a great keyboard, however I bought it because it was advertised as spill-resistant. Unfortunately, I knocked over a glass of soda and it splashed partially across my keyboard. I immediately dried it and got as much liquid out (Less than an once made it over the keyboard itself) and after a couple hours, the BACKSPACE key ceased to work. So it's basically expensive junk now and didn't survive even 1 minor splash.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ben

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Budget RGB Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has been great for typing and gaming. Customization is solid and I've had no issues at all. The typing feels nice (coming from a macbook at least) and isn't loud at all but loud enough for feedback. My only complaint is that the colors between keys blend together and aren't very distinct. Not bothered by it too much since $44 is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly Razer Chroma
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a keyboard with chroma lighting,but never could afford one. Then this one came along and I am so glad I bought it. It is not a mechanical keyboard, but I'm not into that anyway. The matte finish and texture of the keys feels satisfying. After installing Razer Chroma on my computer the real fun began. The software can have certain programs automatically change the Chroma and any macros you have set.
customer_reviews.author: Krassodo

customer_reviews.title: A very solid keyboard with a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this was a great product. Though not as good as other high end keyboards that Razer produces, it is still a fairly great keyboard for a cheap price. The RGB effects are implemented very well while using the easy Razer Synapse and is very helpful in coordinating all of the lights in your setup. Since every key is individually lit, it is very easy to set different keys for different colors if you have a preference. I really do wish they would have added a arm rest, but for this price, I cannot complain. Therefor, if you are looking for a cheap keyboard without a arm rest(then go for the ornata), go with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: Only problem with this product is the software required to change the lighting effects.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. Only problem is that you need to run the new synapse 3 software to be able to change the colors to anything besides the defualt "breathing" effect that cycles through colors. Synapse 3 is not only bloat ware but also tracks keystrokes. No thanks. After a couple days I actually got used to the breathing effect and I like it. So 3 stars, only because the software is garbage
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: It works for gaming or whatever. The color and control of the color is good, I would prefer a lockout button on the keyboard so you can turn it on off as needed. so you can easer get to other apps or browser wile playing to check something or get info.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Construction
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard when it worked, but today, it started registering keys that I was not pressing. At first, I thought maybe it was a driver issue, so I followed some online guides to try and fix the issue to no avail. To test that it was an issue with the hardware itself, I plugged into 2 different PCs and noted the same problem. When typing the "p" key, it registers as "p[" and typing the quote key registers as ';. Very displeased at only getting 6 months of use out of this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: MHRoberts7734

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Dang Good
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much everything you'd want in an LED backlit keyboard at this price point. Only two issues, one is the software, it can be a little inconsistent and sometimes requires a restarting the program once or twice or redownloading the whole thing, but once it works, it works, at least until the next major update, but all in all this only effects the colors. The other thing is that you can, or at least I can, hear a faint high pitch hum from the keyboard itself when connected to my laptop. It doesn't seem to be present with my desktop so it could be a power supply issue, but still, it's odd.
customer_reviews.author: J Heyer

customer_reviews.title: Gamers will love.
customer_reviews.text: My brother freaking loves it!! This thing changes color every few seconds and this is how it looks with my windows open. The light is bright enough. This is made for gamers. He loves it. I am happy. It is bigger in size than my regular keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Havefaith88

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Spent $75 + tax for a new Razer Keyboard, Mouse and mousepad. It was a special deal for Christmas. I couldn't pass up on the special price and the deal that was available. Replaced my old company Microsoft Keyboard and mouse and this keyboard feels much easier to type on, etc. The illumination makes it fun to look at too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: But why are the keys different?
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product a few days ago. It's a great keyboard, and I'm happy with it. But for some unknown reason, contrary to every keyboard I have ever used (and contrary to what is shown in the picture of this product), keys that have multiple functions when used with shift are printed backwards. Example: The 1 is also the ! when shifted, but the 1 is on top of the key, rather than the ! All the symbols on the keys are like that. As I tend to look at the keys rather the screen (habit of a bad typist, I know), it confuses me sometimes. Totally happy with the performance, though, so I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: thadiam

customer_reviews.title: I love it... except for...
customer_reviews.text: The lighting app. You have to be fully loaded and signed into the app in order to get your lighting settings to take. If you log out or switch accounts, it goes back to a random solid color until you sign in again, forcing you to run the app at startup just to not have to take five extra steps just to get your preferred lighting effects. I don't like needless apps running on my computer at startup. Any other keyboard I have gotten holds its settings and reverts immediately on bootup. Other that that hefty complaint, the keyboard is quiet, the design is very nice, and so far no other complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Feels a bit cheap but basically works
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard feels nice and clicky without being too loud, and the backlights are bright and colorful. For some unfortunate reason Razer decided to make the keys of this *keyboard* from that famously awful shade of matte black plastic that attracts fingerprints so well, so keep a microfiber cloth handy. I don't think much of the "extra" features, while some of them, like the audio visualizer, are fun, they all require installing some ridiculous Razer bloatware that always runs in the background. The ability to sync the backlights with the game's audio is underwhelming and only seems to work with a few recent games. Still, a decent and hopefully durable keyboard for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ted curran

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Macros, all kinds of lighting extra's patterns and custom set ups, will communicate with newer games to light up different buttons you use in those games as well. Best keyboard i ever bought for the money. Side note, cleaning it under the keys is extremely easy as well in case something gets under them. The lighting makes it easy to see everything. A must have for a cheaper RGB keyboard to snag.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Best budget Razer RGB keyboard! (PROS and CONS)
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Keyboard quality is really good - Price is fair ( - Bright RGB and you can control the lights using Razer Synapse - Keyboard is fully configurable - It has macros - It has Gaming Mode - It comes with stickers! CONS: - NONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! SUMMARY: This keyboard is pretty good for anything. The price is not that bad for a Razer Keyboard. I bought this keyboard using Prime so It was cheaper! You are going to stare at the RGB lights all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel G.

customer_reviews.title: I think this might be the best keyboard I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome keyboard. The lights and colors are very bright it has a ton of cool patterns and can be customized in a ridiculous way if you have the time. The presets are good enough for me but the best thing about this keyboard is the quality of the keys. Each of them feels like they're coated with a good rubber surface which makes them non-slip but comfortable to touch as well. I recommend buying this keyboard and not looking back
customer_reviews.author: Jason N

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for a mix of work and gaming at home. Overall I am pretty happy with it, its responsive and feels well made overall. I was also able to do some lighting affects to help outline certain keys for gaming, and sync lighting changes with my Razer mouse. My one complaint is that from week 1 it had a squeak in the backspace key. The key still works, but the noise can be irritating at times, which I would have hoped for better than that for 40+ dollar keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Skeen

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. The keys are quiet and the material of the keyboard itself is really nicely made. The Razer software works on mac as well which is neat but I wish there were a little more customization options in terms of RGB lighting. There are a lot of cool effects, but just a little more ways to customize those effects would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pleasure to use, especially when a game supports custom lightning. There is SDK available so if you know what you are doing you can create a custom lightning effect or add support for this keyboard to your program. Note it doesn't have white labels on keys so when the lights are off it maybe a bit difficult to see them. But, who would want to ever turn it off?
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: VERY COOL product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool keyboard. My 13 year old son was making up patterns and experimenting with the colors all night long. Great quality and feel of the keyboard. The only hang up was that while playing Fortnite, the keyboard turned off all of a sudden. We had to go in and watch some YouTube videos to adjust some of the gaming settings for the keyboard. Then we reinstalled the software for the keyboard and it works just fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna M.

customer_reviews.title: For the Horde!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few razor products, such as the kitty edition pink headset, the trinity mouse, and this chroma pro keyboard. I'm blown away with the quality, customization, and ease of use. I dont know if I'll ever go back. They've made mythic+ in world of warcraft so much more enjoyable, and they look good to boot! (:
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality, with some pizzazz
customer_reviews.text: A mechanical keyboard might be a lot of peoples preference, but if you don't really need the clickety clack of a keyboard this membrane thing might be for you. The keys are responsive and the back glow really helps when working late into the night, and the visualizer effect is a beautiful thing to see when you're taking a break to listen to some music. The functions keys are highlighted for you when the "fn" key is pressed, letting you more easily select the function you want. While this may not be important for seasoned pros who remember each function, it's fantastic for those who are still building muscle memory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeaking space bar after < 2 months ruins everything good about this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Good: - Decent size. Not too big or too small. - Great lighting. Bright and helps see the keys. - Most buttons work and feel great. - The keyboard itself is fairly sturdy. Bad: - Read the title. The space bar started squeaking after less than two months of use. It's very obvious, loud, and high pitched - almost like a bird chirp. Unfortunately, in most situations, gaming or not, the space bar is used quite a bit. Even writing this review makes me want to put in headphones so I can *try* to cover up the noise. It pretty much ruins all of the good things I have to say about this keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Andres C.

customer_reviews.title: Orange keys are perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The orange keys feel incredible for gaming. I’m not at all used to it for typing (guaranteed typos when messaging in-game), but I’m not too concerned with that. My only real problem with the keyboard is that the shift keys (?, !, $, etc.) are not illuminated. It’s a really frustrating problem when you spent so much on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Keys are messed up- poor design
customer_reviews.text: I love the colors. The =+ key is however upside down and you can not flip it over correctly. When I contacted razor they claimed it was the design. Major design flaw in my opinion. I won't be buying razor keyboards again.
customer_reviews.author: Lovehurtz02

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great for a budget gamer. Personally I do like having the membrane switches because it is not loud when I play at night. The one issue that I have had with this keyboard is that the backspace key sometimes squeaks. Other than that, the interface to control the RGB lights is very simple and easy to navigate in. I would recommend this keyboard to someone that is looking for a good keyboard at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it’s amazing
customer_reviews.text: Setting up the lights on Chroma is tricky if you’re unfamiliar, but the true extent of the potential of this device is incredible. The lights look awesome. It’s relatively quite for a gaming keyboard. It feels decent, not top notch quality but it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am a notorious keyboard slammer and this poor KB has held up to my daily abuse. I have had it about a year or so - the ability to control the lighting is nice, as are the other features. Quality vs Cost is appropriate, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Az

customer_reviews.title: Just... Buy literally any other Razer keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only Razer keyboard THAT FORCES YOU TO USE THE STUPID SYNAPSE 3 WHICH ABSOLUTELY NO ONE LIKES!!! If you have multiple Razer products (like I do), you have to install Synapse 2 and Synapse 3 and have them running both at the same exact time, which kills full performance for gaming. So much for a gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: It was a great beautiful keyboard, I'd give it 5 stars, but after being used for 7 months it broke. It started randomly typing symbols, letters, zooming in and out when nothing was being pressed. It stopped when we unplugged it (so its not a virus). Wish it didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: LadyL

customer_reviews.title: You gotta type hard or it doesn't recognize key presses + 2 other issues with Razer software
customer_reviews.text: Typing on this keyboard gives me the most typos I'v ever experienced on a keyboard. I have to press the keys all the way to the bottom or it misses keystrokes. I guess I'm more of a soft typer. Also, when installing Razer application, there are two issues: 1. when powering on computer there are no keyboard lights until in Windows and the Razer software is loaded, 2. when emptying the Temp folder, Diablo III quits working until Razer application is removed. Dan
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: What you can expect
customer_reviews.text: Illumination is great, keys are soft touch, membrane have nice feel, keys are not flimsy, you feel you press them, that is something I like. A lot of customization options. One small drawback - finger tips will leave marks on keys, but anyway this is awesome keyboard for the money. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: FleinSopp

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has no back light without installing the razer synapse memory hogging software. Without the software my keyboard is so dark I can't see the keys. When my laptop sleeps the keyboard goes dark. The software forces updates If I want them or not. I will not buy any more razer products.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Last razer product I purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Also synapsis refuse to open It worked then they updated it and broke it. Just search it you will see. After many reinstalls. Thing changes light patterns on it's own and yes I know the settings.Thought Razer was quality but I thought wrong. Another thing the punctuation keys are upside down?? I guess they do thier own thing.
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Key doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard after my last one was accidentally damaged. It has been and continues to be a very annoying experience. The "-" does not work properly. It continues to type "-=" or "=-" instead of the proper key. The "=" key works properly. I can not underscore anything either. Considering I use my computer a lot for work or for gaming, it has been a frustrating experience. Overall, I do not recommend. I'm very disappointed for the quality I got. At this point, my $15 keyboard from Walmart has provided less of a hassle and no issues than this keyboard has.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good for seeing keys at night.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard lights up. That's great. The UI to make it light up requires some investment of time. The keyboard feels OK. The shift plus keystroke gives the lower character not the upper character as I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: F250MoneyPit

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year and 4 months...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a little over one year and then the numpad buttons started failing. Type 0 and get "03", 6 gets you "6." Tested on another computer for accuracy. Average use, light gaming, light office work. Back to my original Logitech G11 (10 years old).
customer_reviews.author: Cruleman

product_meta.title: Razer Cynosa Chroma Gaming Keyboard: 168 Individually Backlit RGB Keys - Spill-Resistant Design - Programmable Macro Functionality - Quiet & Cushioned
product_meta.description: Capacity:Keyboard| Style:Cynosa ChromaThe Razer Cynosa Chroma, the best-selling gaming membrane keyboard in the US (Source: The NPD Group, Inc., U.S. Retail Tracking Service, Keyboards, Non-mechanical keyboard, Gaming Designed Based on dollar sales, Jan.- Dec. 2019),features all the essentials a gamer needs. With soft cushioned, individually programmable backlit keys powered by Razer Chroma—and a spill-resistant design that keeps your keyboard safe—the Cynosa Chroma provides the best performance within its category.
feature_bullets: The #1 Best-Selling Gaming Peripherals Manufacturer in the US: Source - The NPD Group, Inc., U.S. Retail Tracking Service, Gaming Designed: Keyboards, Mice, PC Headsets, and PC Microphones, Based on dollar sales, Jan. 2017- June 2020 combined
All-Around Gaming Performance: Able to execute up to ten commands at the same time with built-in key rollover anti-ghosting

Ultimate Personalization & Gaming Immersion with Razer Chroma: Fully syncs with popular games, Razer hardware, Philips Hue, and gear from 30+ partners; supports 16.8 million colors on individually backlit keys
Spill-Resistant Design: Built to withstand most accidental liquid splashes
Fully Programmable Macros: Razer Hypershift allows for all keys and keypress combinations to be remapped to execute complex commands
Durable Construction: Supports up to 80 million clicks with a 2 year manufacturer warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,813 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
